definition[0]: when you get something that is newer or better than the one you had before
example[0]: Our old car is badly in need of replacement.
definition[1]: someone or something that replaces another person or thing
example[2]: It was difficult to find a replacement for Ted.
definition[2]: a product, piece of equipment etc that takes the place of the one currently being used
example[3]: The device was designed as a replacement for the standard telephone.
definition[3]: someone who takes the place of another person in a job, position etc
example[4]: The company will seek a replacement for its chief finance officer.
definition[4]: when a company gives someone a product instead of one that they bought that was damaged or not perfect
